gurmukhi: suMdr isMG ADMDr kY puin swjn isMG hnXo rn pwXo ]kysn qy gih kY sm lys Drw ptkXo iem ju`D mcwXo ]1276]
transliteration: Soundar Singh Adhandhar Kai Poun(i) Saajan Singh Hanyo Ran Paayo|| Kesan Te Gadh Kai Sabh Les Dharaa Patkyo Im Juddh Machadyo||1276||
translation: Sunder Singh was cut into two halves and then destroyed Sajan Singh; Samlesh Singh was knocked down by catching him from his hair and in this way, a dreadful war was excited.1276.

gurmukhi: Skiq isMG puin hnXo rn sYn isMG hiq dIn ]sPl isMG Air isMG hin isMG nwd hir kIn ]1277]
transliteration: Shakti Singh Poun(i) Hanyo Ran Sain Singh Hati) Deen|| Saphal Singh Ar(i) Singh Han(i) Singh Naad Har(i) Keen||1277||
translation: Then Shakti Singh and Sain Singh were killed; then kin killing Saphal Singh and Ark Singh, Krishna roared llike a lion.1277.

gurmukhi: sÍC nryS kihXo hir isau Apny bl kop AXoDn mY ]Ab qY ds BUp hny blvMf n rMck qRws kIXo mn mY ]
transliteration: Sachh Daresh Kahiyo Har(i) Sio Apne Bal Kop Ayodhan Mai|| Ah Tai Das Bhoop Hane Balvand Na Ranchak Rraas Keeyo Man Mai||
translation: On getting furious, with great strength the king Svachh Singh said to Krishna, “You have already killed fearlessly the ten Kings;”

gurmukhi: jdubIr kI Er qy qIr clY brKw ijm swvn ky Gn mY ]sr paun ky jor lgy n trXo igr ijau iQru TwF rhXo rn mY ]1278]
transliteration: Jadoubeer Kior Te Teer Chalai Barkhaa Jim Saavan Ke Gad Mai|| Sar Paoun Ke Jor Lage Na Daryo Gir Jio Thir(u) Thaadh Rahyo Ran Mai||1278||
translation: From the side of Krishna, the arrows were being showered like the raining clouds of the month of Sawan, but the king Svachh Singh did not even move slightly by the swiftness of arrows and resisted in the battlefield like a mountain.1278.

gurmukhi: jdubIrn so Aiq lrXo ijau bwsv isau jMB ]Acl rhXo iqh Taur niRp ijau rn mY rn KMB ]1279]
transliteration: Jadoubderan So At(i) Daryo Jio Baasav Sio Janbh|| Achal Rahyo Tih Thaur Nrip Jio Ran Mai Ran Khanbh||1279||
translation: The king fought with the Yadavas like Indra with Jambhasura; the king stood stable in the battlefield like a column.1279.

gurmukhi: ijau n hlY igr kMcn ko Aiq hwQn ko bl koaU krY ]Air ijau DRUA lok clY n khU iSv mUrq ijau kbhU n crY ]
transliteration: Jio Na Halai Gir Kanchanndko At(i) Haathan Ko Bal Ko( i)  Darai|| Ar(i) Jio Dhrooa Lok Chalai Na Kahoo Shiv Moondat Jio Kab-hoo Na Cdarai||
translation: Just as the Sumeru mountain is not moved with the strength of the elephants, just as the abode of Dhurva remains firm and the portrait of Shiva does not eat anything;

gurmukhi: br ijau n sqI siq Cwif piqbRiq ijau isD jog mY DXwn DrY ]iqm sXwm cmU mD sÍ`C nryS hTI rn qy nhI nYku trY ]1280]
transliteration: Bar Jio Na Satisat(i) Chhaad(i) Patibrat(i) Jio Sidh Jog Mai Dhyaan Ddarai|| Tim Syaam Chamoondmadh Svachchh Daresh Hathiran Te Nahinaik(u) Darai||1280||
translation: Just as the faithful wife does not swerve from her chastity and the adepts ever remain absorbed in their meditation, in the same manner the persistent Svachh Singh is standing amidst the four divisions of the army of Krishna, standing quite steadily.1280.

gurmukhi: Pyir iqn koip kY AXoDn mY sXwm kih bIr bhu mwry sÍ`C isMG mhwbl sYN ]Aiq rQI siq mhwrQI jug siq qhwN isMDur hjwr hny sXwm jU ky dl sYN ]
transliteration: Pher(i) Tin Kop(i) Kai Ayodhan Mai Syaam Kah(i) Beer Bahu Mdare Svachchh Singh Mahaabal Sain|| At(i) Rathisat(i) Mahaarathijoug Sat(i) Tahaan Sindhur Bajaar Hane Syaam Joo Ke Dal Sain||
translation: Then the mighty Svachh Singh in great fury, killed many of the mighty warriors of the army of Krishna; he killed seven great chariot-owners and fourteen supreme chariot-owners; he also killed thousands of elephants;
